thread.title: Macfarlane tells state governments to sort out coal seam gas
thread.title_full: Macfarlane tells state governments to sort out coal seam gas | afr.com

author: Post to Linkedin
title: Macfarlane tells state governments to sort out coal seam gas
text:
Minister for Industry and Science Ian Macfarlane says activism is strangling the gas supply in the east coast gas market. Stefan Postles He compares the debate in NSW and Victoria to what happened in Queensland, where all levels of politics made a point of telling the story truthfully.
"There was no politicking â€“ it was all fact, all science. Local government, state government, and the federal government all stood shoulder to shoulder, and we brought about the biggest economic revolution to rural Queensland that has occurred in my lifetime.
"We improved the standard of living in many communities. Farmers were winners and communities literally got hundreds of millions of dollars injected directly into their economies, but most importantly, 5000 to 6000 long-term jobs were created.
This is the sort of political fortitude needed in NSW and Victoria, he says.
 "The facts need to be told in this debate, otherwise gas will be locked in the ground, not only in New South Wales and Victoria, but potentially that contagion will spread."
